transcript.text: For almost 40 years now, Hezbollah has taken Lebanon hostage, and Europe was
long overdue to hear the courage of the Lebanese political forces who denounced this
threat, which nevertheless concerns us directly through terrorism, drug trafficking,
large-scale corruption. What a shame. What a shame that
political leaders in our countries like Jean-Luc Mélenchon dared to deplore the
death of Hassan Nasrallah, without even a word for all the people who had suffered this executioner.
The truth, dear colleagues, is that the war he launched against Israel,
this war that Iran wanted, is not that of the Lebanese people. And everything, everything must be done
to prevent civilians from becoming victims, on either side of the borders.
In this crucial moment we have our role to play: finally denounce any complacency
towards this armed Islamist militia which is not and will never be a
legitimate political force; support the unblocking of Lebanese institutions and the election of a president; end
the funding that fuels the Syrian refugee crisis; return Lebanon its freedom,
its sovereignty, and support the Christian presence which constitutes the identity of this country
and the balance of the Middle East. This is the singular responsibility of Europe and
our countries: we have no right to desert it today.
Mr. Bellamy, we have a Blue Card. Mr Smith
What a shame, what a shame to have, through your policy and the support you have
given it for over a year today, allowed the genocide in Gaza, allowed the war
in Lebanon to kill thousands and dozens of thousands of people. It is your actions,
the unconditional support that you have given to Netanyahu's far-right policies,
which today makes us aware of the situation which is the one that you say you deplore, but
in which you participated. Shame yes, but shame on you Mr. Bellamy [Applause]
Mr. Smith, I would not like to be in your place and the one who will be remembered
for you in the history books. The truth is that this spiral of
violence which is causing so many civilian victims, indeed in Gaza but which also gave
rise to the largest anti-Semitic pogrom of the 21st century, was all triggered by Hamas,
it is that is to say by the political force that you are incapable of denouncing,
because your neighbor on the bench, Ms. Hassan, was at a demonstration of support for Ismaïl
Haniyeh, for the leaders of Hamas, in Amman in Jordan this summer. That's the truth,
Mr. Smith. And the truth is that today in our countries, those who are threatened are our
fellow citizens of the Jewish faith, who are taken advantage of every day, for this anti-Semitism to
which you refuse to open your eyes. The fault is on your side, and we will save Europe
and its dignity in your place – and against you, unfortunately, Mr Smith. Thank you so much.
